path: books/Category Theory For Programmers/16. Yoneda Embedding/5

attr.a:
They make vertical compositions. `(b -> a) . (a -> x) = b -> x`
If you know more, please [contribute](https://github.com/ingun37/category-theory-for-programmers-answers).
attr.q: Yoneda embedding can be used to embed an arbitrary functor category `[C, D]` in the functor category `[[C, D], Set]`. Figure out how it works on morphisms (which in this case are natural transformations).
